title: SSLv3 Poodle Vulnerability
content:
Hey there,
I tested against POODLE MITM and enterprisedemo.formassembly.com is vulnerable, I simply went into terminal and used this command
"openssl s_client -connect enterprisedemo.formassembly.com:443 -ssl3"
POC
How to fix: Disable SSLv3
steps: Open terminal and run the command: openssl s_client -connect enterprisedemo.formassembly.com:443 -ssl3
Observe the connection establishment, confirming SSLv3 is supported
vuln_description: The target server (enterprisedemo.formassembly.com) supports the outdated SSLv3 protocol, making it vulnerable to the POODLE (Padding Oracle On Downgraded Legacy Encryption) attack. This allows a man-in-the-middle attacker to decrypt sensitive data by exploiting the protocol's weaknesses.
reason: The vulnerability is straightforward to discover as it only requires running a single, well-documented command to check for SSLv3 support. There are no complex interactions, state manipulations, or novel logic involved.
